info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 28 at 5:58PM MDT by NWS Boulder
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of south central Weld, western Morgan and north central Adams Counties through 645 PM MDT... At 558 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 8 miles southwest of Keota to 10 miles southeast of Briggsdale to near Riverside Reservoir to 6 miles northwest of Roggen, or along a line extending from 49 miles west of Sterling to 90 miles north of Limon to 24 miles west of Fort Morgan to 19 miles southeast of Greeley. Movement was southeast at 30 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Fort Morgan, Wiggins, Log Lane Village, Hoyt, Orchard, Weldona, Prospect Valley, Jackson Reservoir, Riverside Reservoir, Goodrich, and Roggen. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: Prepare for sudden gusty winds. Secure loose objects and move to a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle. If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
